ruleGroup.rule: All torque values must state unit system and tolerance.
Cross-reference other ATA chapters; do not duplicate tasks.
On release, embed QS/UTCS canonical_hash in release notes.
Use '.' as decimal separator; no thousands separators; significant figures must match measurement uncertainty.
Torque tables must specify: fastener type/size, material class, lubrication condition, temperature band, tolerance, and reference spec/version.
System-specific DMs may override generic torque values; overrides must cite the controlling DMC via dmRef.
All materials (sealants/adhesives/RCC/CMC) must reference a controlled specification and revision.
Prefer vector graphics (SVG). Raster images must be â‰¥300 dpi at final size and embedded with alt text.
Figures, tables, and sections must use stable IDs with the pattern sec.*, fig.*, tbl.* for cross-DM linking.
Use S1000D WARNING/CAUTION/NOTE elements; never encode safety text as plain paragraphs.
Do not duplicate content across ATA chapters; use dmRef with explicit DMC instead.
All attached artifacts must follow PLUS-* naming (vehicle-module-feature-rev.ext).
On release, include UTCS/QS canonical_hash and evidence pack references in dmStatus/repositorySourceDmIdent.
